sen.j: 高山ダム（たかやま－）は京都府相楽郡南山城村大字高尾地先、淀川水系木津川左支名張川の合流点より直上流の地点に位置するダムである。
sen.e: Takayama Dam is located at a short distance upstream from the confluence point of Yodo-gawa River System's Kizu-gawa River and its arm Nabari-gawa River in Oaza Takao of Minami Yamashiro Mura, Soraku Gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

Takayama Dam is located a short distance upstream from the confluence point of the Yodo-gawa River System stretch of Kizu-gawa River and its arm Nabari-gawa River in Oaza Takao, Minami Yamashiro Mura, Soraku Gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

Takayama Dam is located a short distance upstream from the confluence point of the Yodo-gawa River System stretch of the Kizu-gawa River and its arm Nabari-gawa River in Oaza Takao, Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gunとしました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 木津川上流ダム群の1つ。
sen.e: It is one of those dams in the upstream area of Kizu-gawa River.
It is one of several dams in the upstream area of Kizu-gawa River.
It is one of several dams in the upstream area of the Kizu-gawa River.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 淀川は近畿地方の大動脈として関西の政治・経済活動に深く関与している。
sen.e: Yodo-gawa River contributes a great deal to Kansai's political and economic activities as a main transportation means in Kinki region.
Yodo-gawa River contributes a great deal to Kansai's political and economic activities as one of the main transportation methods in the Kinki region.
The Yodo-gawa River contributes a great deal to Kansai's political and economic activities as one of the main transportation methods in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 然し古来から氾濫を繰り返す河川でもあった。
sen.e: However, it has made a number of floods since ancient times.
However, it has flooded a number of times over the centuries.
However, it has flooded a number of times over the centuries.

sen.j: この為明治以降瀬田川洗堰建設や巨椋池の宇治川からの離断・干拓、新淀川開鑿等様々な対策を講じていた。
sen.e: So, various measures had been implemented since Meiji Period: building Setagawa-araizeki Barrage, drainage of Oguraike Lake and its isolation from Uji-gawa River, and Shin-Yodogawa-kaisaku (new project of cutting the river wider).

In an attempt to prevent such floods, various measures have been implemented since the Meiji Period such as building Setagawa-araizeki Barrage, the drainage of Oguraike Lake and its isolation from Uji-gawa River, and the Shin-Yodogawa-kaisaku (new project of cutting the river wider).

In an attempt to prevent such floods, various measures have been implemented since the Meiji period such as building Setagawa-araizeki Barrage, the drainage of Oguraike Lake and its isolation from the Uji-gawa River, and the Shin-Yodogawa-kaisaku (new project of cutting the river wider).
sen.cmt: the Meiji Period→the Meiji periodとしました。"Uji-gawa River" -> "the Uji-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: だが1953年（昭和28年）に淀川流域を襲った昭和28年台風第13号は、今までの河川改修を嘲うかのように大きな被害を齎した。
sen.e: In 1953, Typhoon 13th of the year hit Yodo-gawa area to cause huge damages in spite of these river improvement works.
In 1953, the 13th typhoon of the year hit Yodo-gawa area, causing huge damage in spite of these river improvement works.
In 1953, the 13th typhoon of the year hit Yodo-gawa area, causing huge damage in spite of these river improvement works.

sen.j: 全国的に水害の被害が連年勃発し、敗戦で壊滅した日本経済が更に疲弊する事を恐れた経済安定本部は淀川を始め利根川・北上川・木曽川・吉野川・筑後川等主要10水系において河川総合開発計画を進め、これ以上の水害による被害拡大を阻止しようとした。
sen.e: Because floods had caused great damages those years, in fear of further decline of Japan's fragile economy that had been demised by losing the War, the Economic Stabilization Agency tried to stop growing flood damages by working out the comprehensive plan for development of ten main river systems including Yodo-gawa River, Tone-gawa River, Kitakami-gawa River, Kiso-gawa River, Yoshino-gawa River, and Chikugo-gawa River.

Because the floods caused great damage that year, and in fear of further deterioration in the state of Japan's fragile economy that had been decimated by losing the War, the Economic Stabilization Agency tried to prevent increasing flood damage by working out a comprehensive plan for the development of ten main river systems including Yodo-gawa River, Tone-gawa River, Kitakami-gawa River, Kiso-gawa River, Yoshino-gawa River, and Chikugo-gawa River.

Because the floods caused great damage that year, and in fear of further deterioration in the state of Japan's fragile economy that had been decimated by losing the War, the Economic Stabilization Agency tried to prevent increasing flood damage by working out a comprehensive plan for the development of ten main river systems including the Yodo-gawa River, the Tone-gawa River, the Kitakami-gawa River, the Kiso-gawa River, the Yoshino-gawa River, and the Chikugo-gawa River.

sen.j: 多目的ダム建設を骨子とした「河川改訂改修計画」は1949年（昭和24年）に発表されたが、淀川水系においても1954年（昭和29年）より「淀川水系改訂基本計画」が策定された。
sen.e: The "Revised River Improvement Plan" featuring building multipurpose damswas published in 1949, and for Yodo-gawa River system, the "Revised Basic Plan for Improvement of Yodo-gawa River System" was worked out in 1954.
sen.cmt: 河川改訂改修計画→Revised River Improvement Plan[定訳不明]淀川水系改訂基本計画→Revised Basic Plan for Improvement of Yodo-gawa River System[定訳不明]
sen.e: The "Revised River Improvement Plan" including the building of multipurpose damswas published in 1949, and for Yodo-gawa River system, the "Revised Basic Plan for Improvement of Yodo-gawa River System" was fixed in 1954.

The 'Revised River Improvement Plan' including the building of multipurpose damswas published in 1949, and for Yodo-gawa River system, the 'Revised Basic Plan for Improvement of Yodo-gawa River System' was fixed in 1954.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 建設省近畿地方建設局（現・国土交通省近畿地方整備局）はこの計画に沿い、台風13号水害での洪水流量を基準値として治水対策を講じた。
sen.e: In accordance with this plan, Construction Ministry Kinki Regional Construction Bureau (present Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport Kinki Regional Development Bureau) implemented measures of flood control based on the amount of flood water caused by the Typhoon 13th.
sen.cmt: 建設省近畿地方建設局→Construction Ministry Kinki Regional Construction Bureau[定訳不明]
sen.e: In accordance with this plan, the Construction Ministry Kinki Regional Construction Bureau (the current Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport Kinki Regional Development Bureau) implemented measures of flood control based on the amount of flood water caused by Typhoon 13.

In accordance with this plan, the Construction Ministry Kinki Regional Construction Bureau (the current Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport Kinki Regional Development Bureau) implemented measures of flood control based on the amount of flood water caused by Typhoon 13.

sen.j: 淀川本川においては瀬田川浚渫・瀬田川洗堰改築を始め堤防強化に加え、天ヶ瀬ダムを建設する計画を立てた。
sen.e: For the main stream of Yodogawa-River, it worked out a plan to build Amagase Dam in addition to dredging Seta-gawa River, and strengthening dikes such as repairing Setagawa-araizeki Barrage.
For the main stream of Yodogawa-River, it worked out a plan to build Amagase Dam in addition to dredging Seta-gawa River, and strengthening dikes such as repairing Setagawa-araizeki Barrage.
For the main stream of the Yodogawa-River, it worked out a plan to build Amagase Dam in addition to dredging the Seta-gawa River, and strengthening dikes such as repairing Setagawa-araizeki Barrage.

sen.j: 木津川流域においては、木津川本川に有力なダムサイト地点を見出せなかった事から支流の開発を検討。
sen.e: For Kizu-gawa area, it considered development of the tributary area of Kizu-gawa River, because there were no appropriate places to build dams at the main stream of the river.
For Kizu-gawa area, it considered development of the tributary area of Kizu-gawa River, because there were no appropriate places to build dams on the main stream of the river.
For Kizu-gawa area, it considered development of the tributary area of the Kizu-gawa River, because there were no appropriate places to build dams on the main stream of the river.

sen.j: この中で名張川が着目され建設省は名張川本川に月ヶ瀬ダムを、宇陀川に宇陀川ダム（後の室生ダム）を建設する計画を立て、「木津川上流総合開発事業」として1952年（昭和27年）より現地点での予備調査に着手した。
sen.e: Selecting Nabari-gawa River from a short list, the Construction Ministry made a plan to build Tsukigase Dam at the main stream of Nabari-gawa River and Udagawa Dam (later Murou Dam) at Uda-gawa River, and started preliminary study of these sites as the "Comprehensive Development of the Upstream Area of Kizu-gawa River" in 1952.

Selecting Nabari-gawa River from a short list, the Construction Ministry made a plan to build Tsukigase Dam over the main stream of Nabari-gawa River and Udagawa Dam (later Murou Dam) over Uda-gawa River, and started a preliminary study of these sites as the "Comprehensive Development of the Upstream Area of Kizu-gawa River" in 1952.

Selecting the Nabari-gawa River from a short list, the Construction Ministry made a plan to build Tsukigase Dam over the main stream of the Nabari-gawa River and Udagawa Dam (later Muro Dam) over the Uda-gawa River, and started a preliminary study of these sites as the 'Comprehensive Development of the Upstream Area of Kizu-gawa River' in 1952.
sen.cmt: Murou Dam→Muro Damに修正、シングルクォーテーションに変更"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 完成までの道程
sen.e: Development until completion
Development until completion
Development until completion

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）よりダムの具体的な型式や貯水容量等を検討する実施計画調査に入ったが、翌1959年（昭和34年）に伊勢湾台風が台風13号の洪水流量を超える水害を惹き起こした為洪水調節計画を再検討、更に関西圏の急激な人口増加と阪神工業地帯の拡充により水需要が逼迫。
sen.e: Although, in 1958, they started study of implementing the plan that roughly designed specific types of the dams and their capacities of water, they had to review the original flood control plan because Isewan Typhoon of the next year 1959 brought about big floods surpassing that of the Typhoon 13th, and furthermore, water demands grew tremendously due to the rapid growth of the population in Kansai area and the expanding Hanshin Industrial Zone.

Although, in 1958, they began the study of the implementation of the plan to roughly design specific types of dams and their capacities of water, they had to review the original flood control plan because Isewan Typhoon in the following year (1959) brought about considerable flooding, surpassing that of Typhoon 13, and furthermore, water demand grew tremendously due to the rapid growth of the population in the Kansai area and the expanding Hanshin Industrial Zone.

Although, in 1958, they began the study of the implementation of the plan to roughly design specific types of dams and their capacities of water, they had to review the original flood control plan because the Ise Bay Typhoon in the following year (1959) brought about considerable flooding, surpassing that of Typhoon 13, and furthermore, water demand grew tremendously due to the rapid growth of the population in the Kansai area and the expanding Hanshin Industrial Zone.
sen.cmt: Isewan Typhoon→the Ise Bay Typhoonとしました。(参照: http://www.emecs.or.jp/01cd-rom/section_3_e/sec3_ise_e/sec3_ise_top_e.html)

sen.j: 水資源開発の必要性が叫ばれ1962年（昭和37年）に「水資源開発促進法」が施行された。
sen.e: Growing calls for development of water resources resulted in putting "Water Resources Development Promotion Law" into effect in 1962.
Growing calls for the development of water resources resulted in putting "Water Resources Development Promotion Law" into effect in 1962.
Growing calls for the development of water resources resulted in putting 'Water Resources Development Promotion Law' into effect in 1962.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 利根川と共に淀川は「水資源開発基本計画」の指定河川として以後水資源開発公団（現・水資源機構）が総合的な利水事業を行う事となり、高山ダムは宇陀川ダムと共に公団に事業が移管された。
sen.e: After Tone-gawa and Yodo-gawa River Systems were designated for water resources development based on the "Water Resources Development Basic Plan," their comprehensive management of utilization was transferred to Water Resources Development Public Corporation (now Japan Water agency), including the operation of Takayama Dam (former Tsukigase Dam) and Udagawa Dam.

After the Tone-gawa and Yodo-gawa River systems were designated for water resources development based on the "Water Resources Development Basic Plan," their comprehensive management around utilization was transferred to Water Resources Development Public Corporation (now Japan Water agency), including the operation of Takayama Dam (former Tsukigase Dam) and Udagawa Dam.

After the Tone-gawa and Yodo-gawa River systems were designated for water resources development based on the 'Water Resources Development Basic Plan,' their comprehensive management around utilization was transferred to Water Resources Development Public Corporation (now Japan Water agency), including the operation of Takayama Dam (former Tsukigase Dam) and Udagawa Dam.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 補償交渉は京都府・奈良県・三重県の3県に跨り196世帯が水没する上、国指定名勝の月ヶ瀬梅林の一部が水没する事から難航を極めた。
sen.e: Because the area to be submerged under water straddled three prefectures of Kyoto, Nara, and Mie having 196 households, and part of Tsukigase plum-grove park that is designated as national scenic beauty was also to go under water, the negotiations on compensation went through extreme difficulties.

Because the area to be submerged under water straddled the three prefectures of Kyoto, Nara, and Mie having 196 households, and part of Tsukigase plum-grove park that is designated as national scenic beauty was also to go under water, the negotiations on compensation went through extreme difficulties.

Because the area to be submerged under water straddled the three prefectures of Kyoto, Nara, and Mie having 196 households, and part of Tsukigase plum-grove park that was designated as national scenic beauty was also to go under water, the negotiations on compensation went through extreme difficulties.

sen.j: 紆余曲折を経て予備調査開始から17年後の1969年（昭和44年）完成した。
sen.e: After many twists and turns, Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, 17 years after the start of preliminary study.
After many twists and turns, Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, 17 years after the start of the preliminary study.
After many twists and turns, Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, 17 years after the start of the preliminary study.

sen.j: 木津川ダム群の中核
sen.e: Having a key role in the group of Kizugawa Dams
Those having a key role in the group of Kizugawa Dams
Those having a key role in the group of Kizugawa Dams

sen.j: ダムは当初月ヶ瀬ダムの名称であったが、水没する旧・高山村の名称を残したいとする水没住民の意向を受け、現在の高山ダムに名称が変更された。
sen.e: Although its name was initially Tsukigase Dam, accepting the former residents' hope that the name of their Takayama village under water should be kept alive, its name was changed to Takayama Dam.
Although its name was initially Tsukigase Dam, following the former residents' hope that the name of their submerged Takayama village should be kept alive, its name was changed to Takayama Dam.
Although its name was initially Tsukigase Dam, following the former residents' hope that the name of their submerged Takayama village should be kept alive, its name was changed to Takayama Dam.

sen.j: 当初は薗原ダム（片品川）と同じ外観の重力式コンクリートダムとして計画されていたが、比較的岩盤が堅固だった事もあって型式を重力式アーチダムに変更して工事費圧縮を図っている。
sen.e: It was initially planned to be a concrete gravity dam that has the same appearance of that of Sonohara Dam (Katashina-gawa River), but later it was changed to a gravity arch dam to reduce its construction cost, because it turned out that the place had a relatively hard rock ground.

It was initially planned to be a concrete gravity dam with the same appearance of that of Sonohara Dam (Katashina-gawa River), but later it was changed to a gravity arch dam to reduce construction costs, because it turned out that the place had a relatively hard rock ground.

It was initially planned to be a concrete gravity dam with the same appearance of that of Sonohara Dam (Katashina-gawa River), but later it was changed to a gravity arch dam to reduce construction costs, because it turned out that the place had a relatively hard rock ground.

sen.j: 堤高は67.0mであり重力式アーチダムとしては大規模なもので、近畿地方では高山ダム以外には七色ダム（北山川）がある。
sen.e: It is a large scale gravity arch dam of 67.0 meters in height, with Nanairo Dam (Kitayama-gawa River) being other one of the same type in Kinki region.
It is a large scale gravity arch dam of 67.0 meters in height, with Nanairo Dam (Kitayama-gawa River) being the only other of the same type in Kinki region.
It is a large scale gravity arch dam of 67.0 meters in height, with Nanairo Dam (Kitayama-gawa River) being the only other of the same type in Kinki region.

sen.j: 目的は木津川・淀川流域の洪水調節、日本のダム利用目的（木津川流域の既成農地が取水している既得農業用水の確保）、大阪市・枚方市・守口市といった大阪府及び神戸市・西宮市・尼崎市等兵庫県の人口密集地帯への上水道供給、関西電力が行う水力発電（認可出力6,000kW）の多目的ダムである。
sen.e: Objectives of this multipurpose dam are: (1) flood control of Kizu-gawa and Yodo-gawa areas; (2) the common purpose of dams in Japan (supply of water for agriculture that is the vested right of the farmlands in Kizu-gawa area); (3) supply of drinking water to densely-populated areas such as Osaka City, Hirakata City, Moriguchi City (Osaka Prefecture): and Kobe City, Nishinomiya City, and Amagasaki City (Hyogo Prefecture); (4) hydroelectric power generation by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. (permitted output: 6,000 kW).

The objectives of this multipurpose dam are: (1) flood control of the Kizu-gawa and Yodo-gawa areas; (2) the common purpose of dams in Japan (supply of water for agriculture that is the vested right of the farmlands in Kizu-gawa area); (3) the supply of drinking water to densely-populated areas such as Osaka City, Hirakata City, Moriguchi City (Osaka Prefecture): and Kobe City, Nishinomiya City, and Amagasaki City (Hyogo Prefecture); (4) hydroelectric power generation by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. (permitted output: 6,000 kW).

The objectives of this multipurpose dam are: (1) flood control of the Kizu-gawa and Yodo-gawa areas; (2) the common purpose of dams in Japan (supply of water for agriculture that is the vested right of the farmlands in Kizu-gawa area); (3) the supply of drinking water to densely-populated areas such as Osaka City, Hirakata City, Moriguchi City (Osaka Prefecture): and Kobe City, Nishinomiya City, and Amagasaki City (Hyogo Prefecture); (4) hydroelectric power generation by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. (permitted output: 6,000 kW).

sen.j: 名張川筋で初めてのダムで流域ダムの中核的存在を担い、現在は水資源機構・木津川ダム統合管理事務所によって管理されている。
sen.e: Managed by Kizugawa Dam Integrated Operation & Management Office, it plays a key role in the group of dams in Kizu-gawa River System as the first dam at Nabari-gawa River.
Managed by Kizugawa Dam Integrated Operation & Management Office, it plays a key role within the group of dams in the Kizu-gawa River System as the first dam over Nabari-gawa River.
Managed by Kizugawa Dam Integrated Operation & Management Office, it plays a key role within the group of dams in the Kizu-gawa River System as the first dam over Nabari-gawa River.

sen.j: この後名張川流域には青蓮寺ダム（1970年）・室生ダム（1973年）・布目ダム（1991年）・比奈知ダム（1998年）が相次いで完成し、関西圏の重要な水がめとなっている。
sen.e: Later, Shorenji Dam (1970), Murou Dam (1973), Nunome Dam (1991), and Hinachi Dam (1998) were completed to make important water resources for Kansai region.
Later, Shorenji Dam (1970), Murou Dam (1973), Nunome Dam (1991), and Hinachi Dam (1998) were completed to make important water resources for the Kansai region.
Later, Shorenji Dam (1970), Muro Dam (1973), Nunome Dam (1991), and Hinachi Dam (1998) were completed to make important water resources for the Kansai area.
sen.cmt: Muro Damとしました。「関西圏」→前出の表記にあわせ、"Kansan area"としました。

sen.j: 尚、木津川の左支川・前深瀬川には現在川上ダムが建設中であるが、2005年（平成17年）の「淀川水系流域審議会」の答申により『建設中止が妥当』という判断が下され、機構を所管する国土交通省は治水ダムへの変更を図ろうとしているが、三重県や伊賀市、流域住民や移転住民から計画通りの建設を行うべきと反発を受けている。
sen.e: Kawakami Dam is under construction at Maefukase-gawa River that is a subsidiary stream on the left of Kizu-gawa River, while Yodogawa River System Committee's recommendation of 2005 led to the conclusion that "it is appropriate to abort the construction," and the agency's supervisory Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism intends to change the dam to a flood-control dam, but Mie Prefecture, Iga City, residents in the river area, and those residents to move out oppose the Ministry's intention saying that the construction should be continued as it is planned.
sen.cmt: 淀川水系流域審議会→Yodogawa River System Committee[定訳不明]
sen.e: Kawakami Dam is under construction at Maefukase-gawa River, a subsidiary stream on the left of Kizu-gawa River, while Yodogawa River System Committee's recommendations in 2005 led to the conclusion that "it is appropriate to abort the construction," and the agency's supervisory Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism intends to change the dam to a flood-control dam, but Mie Prefecture, Iga City, residents in the river area, and those residents to move out oppose the Ministry's intention saying that the construction should be continued as it is planned.

Kawakami Dam is under construction at the Maefukase-gawa River, a subsidiary stream on the left of the Kizu-gawa River, while Yodogawa River System Committee's recommendations in 2005 led to the conclusion that "it is appropriate to abort the construction," and the agency's supervisory Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism intends to change the dam to a flood-control dam, but Mie Prefecture, Iga City, residents in the river area, and those residents to move out oppose the Ministry's intention saying that the construction should be continued as it is planned.

sen.j: 観光
sen.e: Tourist information
Tourist information
Tourist information

sen.j: ダム湖の名前は月ヶ瀬湖と命名されたが、名前の元になったのは湖畔にある名勝・月ヶ瀬梅林である。
sen.e: The lake was named Lake Tsukigase, which came from the Tsukigase plum-grove park, a scenic spot at the lakeside.
The lake was named Lake Tsukigase, which came from the Tsukigase plum-grove park, a scenic spot by the lakeside.
The lake was named Lake Tsukigase, which came from the Tsukigase plum-grove park, a scenic spot by the lakeside.

sen.j: 春には1万本以上のウメが咲き乱れ関西・名古屋方面から多数の観光客が訪れ、春の息吹を目と匂いで楽しませている。
sen.e: Every spring more than ten thousand plum trees are in bloom at this park, where many tourists from Kansai and Nagoya regions enjoy their spring flavor and scenery.
Every spring more than ten thousand plum trees are in bloom in this park, where many tourists from the Kansai and Nagoya regions enjoy their spring scent and the scenery.
Every spring more than ten thousand plum trees are in bloom in this park, where many tourists from the Kansai and Nagoya regions enjoy their spring scent and the scenery.

sen.j: 梅林付近には月ヶ瀬温泉もある他、伊賀上野城や忍者屋敷、後醍醐天皇が潜幸した笠置山の渓谷が近郊にあり、少し足を伸ばせば長谷寺・室生寺・赤目四十八滝・香落渓も近距離にある。
sen.e: In addition to Tsukigase Onsen (hot spring) close to the plum-grove park, not far from here are Iga Ueno-jo Castle, a ninja house, and Kasagi-yama Valley where Emperor Godaigo secretly visited, and one can go a little farther to see Hase-dera Temple, Muro-ji Temple, Akame Shijuhachi-taki Falls, and Kochi-dani Valley.

In addition to Tsukigase Onsen (hot spring), which is close to the plum-grove park, Iga Ueno-jo Castle, a ninja house, and Kasagi-yama Valley where Emperor Godaigo secretly visited, are nearby, and if you go a little farther you can see Hase-dera Temple, Muro-ji Temple, Akame Shijuhachi-taki Falls, and Kochi-dani Valley.

In addition to Tsukigase Onsen (hot spring), which is close to the plum-grove park, Iga Ueno-jo Castle, a ninja house, and the valley of Mt. Kasagi where Emperor Godaigo secretly visited, are nearby, and if you go a little farther you can see Hase-dera Temple, Muro-ji Temple, Akame Shijuhachi-taki Falls, and Kochi-dani Valley.
sen.cmt: Kasagi-yama Valley→the valley of Mt. Kasagiとしました。

sen.j: 国道25号・名阪国道がダム付近を通過している為自動車でのアクセスが便利で、大阪市・京都市の各中心部から1時間半位で行く事が可能である。
sen.e: Using a car is recommended to reach the dam, because National Route 25 and Meihan National Route run close by, and it takes about 90 minutes to get there from the center of either Osaka City or Kyoto City.

Using a car is recommended to reach the dam, because National Route 25 and Meihan National Route run close by, and it takes about 90 minutes to get there from the center of either Osaka City or Kyoto City.
